thread.title: Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open
thread.title_full: Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open

title: Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open
text:
Andy Wong Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open 
Eugenie Bouchard of Canada, center, talks with medical staff before retiring from her first round match against Andrea Petkovic of Germany at the China Open tennis tournament at the National Tennis Stadium in Beijing, Monday, Oct. 5, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Andy Wong Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open 
Eugenie Bouchard of Canada covers her face with a towel as she leaves the court after retiring from her first round match against Andrea Petkovic of Germany at the China Open tennis tournament at the National Tennis Stadium in Beijing, Monday, Oct. 5, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015 4:13 am | Updated: 5:00 am, Mon Oct 5, 2015. Bouchard retires from opening match at China Open Associated Press | 
BEIJING (AP) — A teary-eyed Eugenie Bouchard retired from her opening match against Andrea Petkovic at the China Open due to dizziness on Monday, her first match since falling at the U.S. Open last month and suffering a concussion. 
Bouchard slipped in the locker room after her third-round win against Dominika Cibulkova at the U.S. Open, falling backward and landing hard on the back of her head. She was forced to withdraw from the tournament, as well as subsequent tournaments in Tokyo and Wuhan. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.
